founderNote: Palmer Luckey is Founder but Brian Schimpf is CEO. Luckey is the public face and primary spokesperson.

structuralFindings.rationale: Anduril is a born-AI organization founded in 2017 specifically to build AI-powered defense technology. There is no legacy transformation happening - AI is the core DNA. The company was built from day one around the Lattice AI platform, autonomous systems, and AI-powered hardware. The entire business model assumes AI as foundational, not additive. This is definitional M9 AI-Native.
structuralFindings.aiTeamStructure: AI is not a separate team or function at Anduril - it is the foundational layer of all products. The Lattice AI platform is the core operating system that powers all Anduril products including drones (Ghost, Fury), counter-UAS systems (Roadrunner), submarines (Dive XL), and mixed reality systems (EagleEye). Engineering is distributed across product divisions (Integrated Systems for Space/Intelligence, Air Dominance, Maritime, etc.) with AI/ML embedded in each. Internal Tools team (~280 people) supports 35+ product lines. No CAIO role exists because AI is not treated as a separate discipline requiring special leadership - it's assumed as baseline capability.

keyPeople.name: Palmer Luckey
keyPeople.title: Founder
keyPeople.role: Primary public spokesperson, product vision, defense philosophy

structuralFindings.investmentSignals: $2.5B Series G raised June 2025 at $30.5B valuation. $1B manufacturing facility (Arsenal-1) in Ohio announced January 2025 with production starting July 2026. $1B from Founders Fund alone. Expected to burn $800M-$900M in 2025 for major programs. Revenue grew 138% from $420M (2023) to $1B (2024), estimated $2B for 2025. OpenAI partnership announced December 2024. Acquired American Infrared Solutions (AIRS) October 2025. Took over $22B IVAS contract from Microsoft February 2025.

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: No separate AI reporting structure - AI capability is embedded in product divisions. CEO Brian Schimpf oversees all operations. Luckey serves as primary vision-setter and external spokesperson but is not operational CEO.
observableMarkers.resourceAllocation: 100% of R&D is AI-related because all products are AI-powered autonomous systems. Arsenal-1 ($1B) is being built for AI-enabled manufacturing. Lattice is the common AI platform across all products.
observableMarkers.timeHorizons: Mixed: Some products ship in months (Ghost drones, Sentry towers), but major programs like YFQ-44A Fury CCA and Arsenal-1 are multi-year. Luckey emphasizes 'months not years' compared to traditional defense primes.
observableMarkers.decisionRights: Highly centralized around founding team. Small founder group (Luckey, Schimpf, Grimm, Stephens, Chen) makes strategic decisions. Product teams have autonomy in execution.
observableMarkers.metrics: Contracts won, production speed, cost vs. traditional defense primes. Luckey frequently benchmarks against consumer AI (Tesla autopilot, Roomba autonomy) to argue defense systems lag.

quotes.text: The United States needs to arm our allies and partners around the world so that they can be prickly porcupines that nobody wants to step on.
quotes.speaker: Palmer Luckey
quotes.context: Explaining philosophy on autonomous weapons as deterrence

quotes.text: The future of warfare will be superficially hardware-driven with a buttload of software smarts under the hood making it all actually work.
quotes.speaker: Palmer Luckey
quotes.context: Describing the role of AI in defense hardware

quotes.text: AI in warfare is no longer hypothetical; it's inevitable.
quotes.speaker: Palmer Luckey

quotes.text: In our lifetimes you'll be able to go buy something like a Ford F-150 for $1,000.
quotes.speaker: Palmer Luckey
quotes.context: At a16z Founders Summit, discussing how AI will transform manufacturing costs

quotes.text: This is what I mean when I say we don't need technological breakthrough so much as we need to just do things. The tech to do this is going to catch up.
quotes.speaker: Palmer Luckey
quotes.context: On applying existing AI to manufacturing at scale

quotes.text: AI is going to make it easier for resource extraction, processing, and manufacturing.
quotes.speaker: Palmer Luckey
quotes.context: Describing AI's impact on industrial processes

quotes.text: The components are not expensive. It's the transformation and the regulation that have made it really expensive.
quotes.speaker: Palmer Luckey
quotes.context: Arguing that policy not technology limits AI-driven manufacturing

quotes.text: This is an open challenge. If you think you can build an autonomy stack that can out-fly the world's best, show us.
quotes.speaker: Palmer Luckey
quotes.context: Announcing AI Grand Prix autonomous drone competition

summary: Anduril is a definitional AI-Native (M9) organization founded in 2017 specifically to build AI-powered defense technology. There is no AI transformation happening because AI is the foundational DNA - the Lattice platform powers all products from drones to submarines to mixed reality helmets. At $30.5B valuation with $1B+ revenue and a $22B IVAS contract from Microsoft, Anduril has validated the AI-native defense model. Palmer Luckey serves as chief evangelist and vision-setter, though Brian Schimpf is CEO.
openQuestions: What is the internal AI/ML team structure within product divisions?
How is the OpenAI partnership structured operationally?
What specific AI/ML talent pipeline and hiring practices does Anduril use?
How does Lattice platform governance work across product lines?
What are the specific AI R&D budget allocations vs. manufacturing/production?
conferenceFindings: No dedicated AI/tech conference presence found - Luckey primarily speaks at defense, business, and general tech venues (TED, Abundance Summit, a16z Founders Summit, Shawn Ryan Show). The AI Grand Prix (Fall 2026) represents a novel approach to recruiting AI talent through competition rather than traditional conference presence.

specimenRecommendation.rationale: Anduril is the paradigm case of M9 AI-Native in defense. High quotability from Luckey, clear structural model, rich data on investments and products. Essential for any discussion of born-AI organizations.
specimenRecommendation.taxonomyFit: Perfect fit for M9 AI-Native. The company literally did not exist before AI - it was founded to apply AI to defense, not to add AI to an existing defense business.
